title: Inconsistent Interpretation of HTTP Requests (&#x27;HTTP Request Smuggling&#x27;)
overview: When malformed or abnormal HTTP requests are interpreted by one or more entities in the data flow between the user and the web server, such as a proxy or firewall, they can be interpreted inconsistently, allowing the attacker to smuggle a request to one device without the other device being aware of it.
remediation: ::PHASE:Implementation:STRATEGY::EFFECTIVENESS::DESCRIPTION:Use a web server that employs a strict HTTP parsing procedure, such as Apache [REF-433].::PHASE:Implementation:STRATEGY::EFFECTIVENESS::DESCRIPTION:Use only SSL communication.::PHASE:Implementation:STRATEGY::EFFECTIVENESS::DESCRIPTION:Terminate the client session after each request.::PHASE:System Configuration:STRATEGY::EFFECTIVENESS::DESCRIPTION:Turn all pages to non-cacheable.::
